ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: I CALL TO witness the heavens and the night Star --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By the heaven, and the night-visitor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: By oath of the heaven, and by oath of the nightly arriver.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: I swear by the heaven and the comer by night;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: By the heaven and the Morning Star
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By the heavens and that which comes in the night --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the heaven and the night-comer
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: By the heaven, and by the nightly visitor
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By the Sky and the Night-Visitant (therein);-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: By the heaven, and At-Tariq (the night-comer, i.e. the bright star);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: By the sky, and by the nightly comer!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: By the sky and the night comer -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [86:1] By the heaven and the night-visitor! (al-tāriq actually denotes any thing that comes by night, including stars, because they come out at night).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (By the heaven and the Morning Star): '(By the heaven and the Morning Star) He says: Allah swears 746 by the heaven and the morning star
